intro: Mespilodaphne tristis, commonly known as the black mangosteen, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark, glossy leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces edible, purple-black fruits that are rich in antioxidants and have a sweet, tangy flavor. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and commercial purposes.
